body_html:
We have always shipped TensorBoard with TensorFlow, and we will keep it that way. We have split it out into a separate package, but the expectation is that TensorFlow comes with a visualization tool.

The circular dependency is not a problem for pip, so I don't see that causing trouble. We are working on pulling the dependencies out such that TB does not depend on TF.

If you don't want TB, you can always tell pip to not install it, or remove it without causing harm. I'm not sure what the advantage of this would be though. For packaging, the pip dependency structure should not matter at all -- if you are making a deb, rpm, or other package, feel free to include dependencies as you see fit.
